main_definition: Polo is primarily known as a sport involving two teams playing on a grass field with horses, but it can also refer to various other meanings.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A team sport played by two teams of players using mallets to hit a ball over a high net while riding horses.
meanings_and_examples.example: The annual polo match between Eton and Harrow schools is one of the most prestigious events in English sports history.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A type of long-sleeved shirt, often associated with rural or working-class clothing.
meanings_and_examples.example: He wore his favorite polo shirt to the casual outdoor wedding.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Short for 'polytetrafluoroethylene', a brand name of Teflon, used in non-stick cookware and other products.
meanings_and_examples.example: She sprayed some polo on the pan to prevent food from sticking.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A type of boat or sailboat with two masts and a distinctive color scheme, often associated with nautical activities or clubs.
meanings_and_examples.example: The members proudly displayed their blue and white polo boats at the regatta.
